revised_title: Founders of Marine Science in Britain: Early Fellows of the Royal Society
tldr: This article discusses the early interest in marine science among the founding members of the Royal Society. It highlights the contributions of key figures like Robert Boyle, Robert Hooke, and Sir Robert Moray, as well as the systematic approach to studying the sea and its phenomena. The article also covers the advancements in marine science during the 17th century, including the publication of significant works by Boyle and Isaac Newton.
